title: Freedom of Information Act ("FOIA") request regarding charges of employment discrimination based on arrest record

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

The number/ quantity of reports of employment discrimination based on arrest record as defined and prohibited by 775 ILCS 5/2-103 from January 2022 to December 2023.  

In the unlikely event that you claim any portion of the above public records to be exempt from disclosure under 5 ILCS 140, in writing please (i) identify which portion or portions you claim are exempt and the statutory provision or provisions you contend apply; (ii) set forth the reasons for your conclusion that such portion or portions are exempt; and (iii) release the remainder of such records for inspection and copying, redacting only the portion or portions you claim are exempt.   

Please note that the statute does not allow your agency to withhold documents in their entirety if only parts of the records may be exempt.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Ruth

title: Freedom of Information Act Request (“FOIA”) regarding charges of housing discrimination based on arrest record

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

The number of complaints filed with the Illinois Department of Human Rights pursuant to 775 ILCS 5/3-102 concerning civil rights violations in real estate transactions for those with an arrest record from January 2022 to December 2023. 

The outcome of these complaints. 

In the unlikely event that you claim any portion of the above public records to be exempt from disclosure under 5 ILCS 140, in writing please (i) identify which portion or portions you claim are exempt and the statutory provision or provisions you contend apply; (ii) set forth the reasons for your conclusion that such portion or portions are exempt; and (iii) release the remainder of such records for inspection and copying, redacting only the portion or portions you claim are exempt.   

Please note that the statute does not allow your agency to withhold documents in their entirety if only parts of the records may be exempt.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Ruth

title: Freedom of Information Act Request (“FOIA”) regarding petitions for review for health care worker licenses

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern: 

In accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (5 ILCS 140), I hereby request access to the following records in the Illinois Department of Financial & Professional Regulation’s possession:  

The number of waivers sought under 20 ILCS 2105/2105-165 for healthcare workers convicted of a forcible felony, other than a forcible felony requiring registration under the Sex Offender Registration Act, involuntary sexual servitude of a minor that is a forcible felony, or a criminal battery against any patient in the course of patient care or treatment, is not required to register as a sex offender, and has had his or her license revoked pursuant to item (3) of subsection (a) of 20 ILCS 2105/2105-165 from January 2022 to December 2023.  

The number of waivers granted to healthcare workers under 20 ILCS 2105/2105-165 from January 2022 to December 2023. 

The number of waivers for eligible healthcare workers under 20 ILCS 2105/2105-165 rejected from January 2022 to December 2023. 

In the unlikely event that you claim any portion of the above public records to be exempt from disclosure under 5 ILCS 140, in writing please (i) identify which portion or portions you claim are exempt and the statutory provision or provisions you contend apply; (ii) set forth the reasons for your conclusion that such portion or portions are exempt; and (iii) release the remainder of such records for inspection and copying, redacting only the portion or portions you claim are exempt.  

Please note that the statute does not allow your agency to withhold documents in their entirety if only parts of the records may be exempt.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Ruth
